meanings.definition: Of or relating to an effigy.
meanings.sent1: The effigial statue was made to honor a great leader.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an effigial sculpture of the famous historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The effigial puppet at the museum seemed to come to life and wave at visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her effigial presence in the room made everyone feel like she was still there.
meanings.sent5: The effigial image on the banner was so realistic, it startled the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: The effigial mask worn by the performer was striking and detailed.
meanings.sent2: The effigial figure in the parade looked just like the famous character.
meanings.sent3: The effigial scarecrow in the field made the birds think twice before landing.
meanings.sent4: His effigial costume for Halloween was so convincing, people mistook him for a statue.
meanings.sent5: The effigial painting captured the essence of the subject with incredible accuracy.

meanings.definition: In the form of an effigy.
meanings.sent1: The effigial torch carried by the protesters symbolized their cause.
meanings.sent2: The effigial banners lining the street depicted the heroes of the past.
meanings.sent3: The effigial balloons at the fair floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The effigial decorations at the party added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The effigial monument in the park stood tall as a tribute to the fallen soldiers.
